name: In your head
description:
There was one robot, it wasn't the strongest, the smartest, or the fastest. A simple robot support. However, he did have something unique that no other creation of mankind has-consciousness and self-consciousness. No one knew about it. And then, one day there is a crisis moment, the owners are attacked by a gang of armed men. After one of the owners is shot, a Completely non-combat robot, in which the laws of robotics are sewn, consciously decides to violate them, neutralizes two of them "bandits", however, the others take advantage and shoot the robot, however, the robot survives, but various parts of the processor were damaged (including those responsible for security protocols, and adequacy), as a result of which it falls into a frenzy and destroys everyone who was around until it finally turned off. The game starts when the robot is disabled. the backup systems begin to recover, and the robot's consciousness is loaded into one of the repairmen's microbots. the player controls the microbot, gradually restoring the system learning parts of the robot's history, and at some point the player is faced with a choice-to restore the robot, or allow the protocols to completely disable all functions.

Connect blocks and solve puzzles. 

To attach the unit, you need to shoot the first connector in the power supply, and the second-in the unit to be connected (or Vice versa). Powered blocks light up.

There are points of interest with interesting information.

Blocks:

  • Core (light blue) - it has a charge and can power other units
  • Engine (blue) - moving platform (when there is energy)
  • Teleport (purple) - opens the teleport entrance and exit
  • Extension (white) - Allows you to record the next block that can't be reached directly
  • Splitter (green) - Allows you to power the following 2 blocks

Controls:

  • F5 - Restart
  • F12 - Quit game
  • WASD - Move
  • Space - Jump
  • Left mouse button - shoot connector
  • Left mouse button hold - charge the power of the shot
